title: How to Draw a Treble Clef

steps.headline: Get a piece of music paper.
steps.description: Music paper has five lines and four spaces in between. If you don't have any music paper, just draw five evenly spaced horizontal lines with a ruler. Make sure to draw the lines neat if you don't have music paper,so it comes out right

steps.headline: Draw a vertical line.
steps.description: Make sure it's intersecting all of the lines from the music paper. It should be a little longer, so that it hangs off both ends.

steps.headline: Make the line a "P".
steps.description: Draw a semi-circle at the top of the vertical line that ends at the second horizontal line down. Now it should look like a long and skinny "P".

steps.headline: Continue across the vertical line and make another semi-circle.
steps.description: This new line should curve around the other side of the vertical line and intersect it again at the last horizontal line.

steps.headline: Continue to make the previous semi-circle into a spiral.
steps.description: You're essentially making a semi-circle that's slightly smaller than the previous one. Make it so that the top goes a little over the third horizontal line.

steps.headline: Finish the spiral.
steps.description: The spiral should end on the second (from the bottom) horizontal line, which indicates the note "G".

steps.headline: Draw a tail at the end.
steps.description: Go to the end of the first line you drew, and draw a little line going off of it as shown.

text: Get a piece of music paper. Music paper has five lines and four spaces in between. If you don't have any music paper, just draw five evenly spaced horizontal lines with a ruler. Make sure to draw the lines neat if you don't have music paper,so it comes out right Draw a vertical line. Make sure it's intersecting all of the lines from the music paper. It should be a little longer, so that it hangs off both ends. Make the line a "P". Draw a semi-circle at the top of the vertical line that ends at the second horizontal line down. Now it should look like a long and skinny "P". Continue across the vertical line and make another semi-circle. This new line should curve around the other side of the vertical line and intersect it again at the last horizontal line. Continue to make the previous semi-circle into a spiral. You're essentially making a semi-circle that's slightly smaller than the previous one. Make it so that the top goes a little over the third horizontal line. Finish the spiral. The spiral should end on the second (from the bottom) horizontal line, which indicates the note "G". Draw a tail at the end. Go to the end of the first line you drew, and draw a little line going off of it as shown. Finished.
